attributes.action: Force MP's to reflect their constituency vote In their Final In or Out Vote
attributes.additional_details:
If the EU want a deal, then let them make it with us. Not the other way round.

Many people find it incomprehensible that most other countries in the world trade under WTO rules with each other and in some cases the EU. Why then could this not apply to the UK
attributes.background: It is felt that MP's should be forced to reflect the voting outcome in their constituency of the June 23rd Brexit referendum. This would ensure that the result of the referendum is implemented. There should not be any need to further complicate the issue with deals.

rejection.details:
How an MP votes would be an individual decision for that person, and not a decision for the Government or Parliament as a whole.

You could ask your own MP to vote according to the result of referendum in your constituency. You can find out who your MP is and how to contact them here: 

https://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
